title: What in the World Is That?
description: Students can be animal detectives as they read What in the World Is That? By using the clues in the book, can they determine what the mystery animal is before the end of the book? The author compares and contrasts the unknown animal and different creatures, revealing more and more of its attributes with each comparison. Students will be so absorbed with the fun of unraveling the mystery that they won't even realize that they are learning to make predictions and identify main idea and details.
meta: bill, claw, feathers, gnaw, platypus, sleek, strange, webbed, whiskers
Use the reading strategy of making, revising, and confirming predictions to understand text
Main Idea and Details : Identify main idea and details
Question Marks : Recognize and apply questions marks
Concept Words : Recognize and use question words

Promote higher-order thinking for small groups
or whole class
